intro: Arabis canadensis, commonly known as Canadian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in early spring. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
